entry.title: Defeat my Mind, Defeat my body
entry.summary: A strong mind stands tall in the adversity. A setback can be called a defeat only if the mind accepts it.
entry.content:
Kabeer is one of the India’s favorite mystics. He, with words and thoughts kept challenging the monopoly of the stereotype existent in the people of those times. His verses present him as an epitome of humility who doesn’t shy from mocking the things he finds useless. He puts his opinion with a clarity but laces his expression with a plethora of metaphors and figures of speech. Thus it is easy to understnd what he disagrees but it takes an effort to find out what he says and means.

He in his poems talks to his mind and his words have a penetrability, they reverberate in the readers mind and cleanse it. I would elaborate my point with the translation of one of his poems.

Kabeer could easily offend the sensitive religious and administrative heavy weights and he was not tolerated by some people fr his views and songs. They complained about him to the King. A decision was taken to throw him in to the river. He was chained and thrown into the water. But while in water, he pulled his hands out and feet out of the chains and swam to the shore. People were taken aback to see him alive.

A verse in SGGS narrates the story thus.

Ganges, the holy river, is profound and deep.
Chained and fettered, they brought Kabeer there.

When you cannot defeat my mind,
how can the fear affect my body?
I had stilled my mind on the Lotus feet of God.

Those waves of Ganges, opened my chains,
I was, as if, floating on a deer skin.

Says Kabeer, when no one is with you to help,
Raghunath will protect you on the Earth and Water.
— SGGS 1162

Kabir has a special relation of love with the cosmos and the Providence and he calls it Raam. The real thing which saved Kabir, was in his own words, the grace of God. Talking in our perspective, it was the positivism in the thoughts which he had maintained. He says you cannot terrorize my mind, since I have the support of someone stronger than you.

When mind does not entertain the fear, the body becomes strong. Most of our fears are hypothetical and not even genuine. Even if the fears and the problems are genuine, our attitude can still make a difference.

When we are not ready to accept defeat, we cannot be defeated. We are defeated when we acknowledge that we are. I would like to end it as Ernest Hemingway puts it "A man can be destroyed but not defeated."

entry.title: Shikwa
entry.content:
yoon umadh ghtaa,jab neelamber pe chhaa gyi,
guzrey zamaanon ki ek baat yaad aa gyi.

When the black clouds rose in the sky, that dark ambience made me remember an event form the past.

kaun thhey hum, kaun ho ab gaye hain,
kaunsi blaa hamari hasti mitaa gayi.

What I used to be and What I am now, What was that damn cause responsible for annihilation of my identity?

Ik arsey se thama rakhi yaad jo dil mein,
kyu ab humse yeh shairi krwaa gayi.

Since ages I had buried your thoughts deep in my heart, Why is it now that they erupt as poetry?

kyu sukoon si woh saawan ki baad-e-swa,
yoon ban aaj dasht ki zalim kzaa gyi.

Why that soothing cool breeze of the rainy season has transmuted into rash gush, as in the autumn in a dry desert?

jawani dhali bina machhli koi pakde,
pakeezgi k daawon mein buzurgi bharmaa gyi.

Because young age has passed without flirting with maidens, now this old age boasts of that piety.

chalo jo bhi hua sab quboola adab se,
par gaya na mann se shikwa yahi ki,

I acknowledge everything that happened in the past as 'good', ( I bow to Providence in gratitude), except one complaint, to the Providence, which still hounds my mind.

udte rhe sab parinde hawa mein,
bas koyal hamari hi pinjre ko bhaa gyi.

When all birds were free soaring high in the skies, why was that only my beloved nightingale chosen for the 'cage'?

entry.title: What to say?
entry.content:
Bewitched

A naive tuft of rose, in a gleamy morn clear
Secretly whispered to me, my heart did hear.
What to say dear?? I’ll lose my being, I fear.

A 'Maiden' sublime in a black cascade(apparel)
With a smile so sharp as a deadly blade,

From Valley of Beauty, she kisses the Moon,
Every glimpse of her face,enchants me to swoon.

Resides in my fantasies, that picture so clear.

What to say dear?? I’ll lose my being,I fear.

Who knew she wud so, disappear
Would be so far, and still so near

What to say dear??  I’ll lose my being , I fear.

Background

It was written in 2010 on insistence of a friend who wanted to gift a poem to someone.
